page.title: 19RECREATION AROUND HOWNAM
page.content: The people who live in this area,near the village of Hownam in the Scottish Borders,do not regularly travel far from home for entertainments sake. Not one goes to play bingo,and less than a quarter visit a public house often. Most people only go out for a meal or dancing occasionally, and only the young adults travel to take part in outdoor sports or swimming.About half of the people play indoor sports,which is mainly the bowling at Hownam. Most play cards or board games,about a third go for walks,make jigsaws or do home improvements.Almost half enjoy photography,and 7 do flower arranging. A few do crosswords,painting,riding, carpentry,fishing,painting,D.I.Y, or bird watching,and 4 play a musical instrument.There are 2 shepherds who show sheep and 1 farmer who runs dogs at many of the local shows.
